text: Submit with sbatch and a job script, e.g., `sbatch my_job_script.sh`.
Use `squeue -u <your_username>` to see your jobs' status.
Request a GPU with `#SBATCH --gres=gpu:1` in the script (or `--gres=gpu:1` to sbatch).
Cancel a job with `scancel <job_id>`.
`#SBATCH` lines set Slurm options (partition, time, memory, GPUs, etc.) inside the script.
Start an interactive session with `srun --partition=<queue> --time=HH:MM:SS --pty bash`.
Run `sinfo --list-reasons` to list offline nodes and their reasons.
Use `/scratch/<NetID>` for temporary job data; it is fast, not backed up, and files >90 days inactive may be purged.
/home provides 100 GB of backed‑up storage by default.
Add community modules with `module use /projects/community/modulefiles`, then `module spider` or `module avail`.
Add `module load <name>/<version>` lines to your `~/.bashrc` to load modules on login.
Specify the GPU queue with `#SBATCH --partition=gpu` in your script.
Use `sacct -j <job_id>` (or `sacct` with filters) to inspect completed jobs.
Submit arrays with `#SBATCH --array=1-300` (or `sbatch --array=1-300 script.sbatch`).
Use dependencies, e.g., `#SBATCH --dependency=afterok:<job_id>` so a job starts after another succeeds.
Grant access with ACLs: `setfacl -m u:<netid>:rwx <path>` and verify with `getfacl <path>`. Ensure parent dirs are accessible.
Stage inputs with scp, e.g., `scp data.tgz user@amarel:/scratch/$USER && tar -zxf /scratch/$USER/data.tgz`.
Use `sinfo` to list partitions and nodes (and their states).
Owners use `/projects/<id>` for shared data; it is backed up via snapshots (no automated purging).
Guest NetIDs may submit to general partitions by adding `#SBATCH -A general` (policy subject to change).
`/mnt/scratch` is node‑local fast storage for jobs; clean it up before the job ends.
Run GPU containers with Apptainer using `--nv` and bind mounts, e.g., `apptainer exec --nv image.sif <cmd>`.
Compile/install to your space (e.g., /home or /projects) with `./configure --prefix=... && make && make install`; yum/apt are not available.
Use `scontrol show res` to inspect reservations and `scontrol show config` for scheduler settings.
Home snapshots live under `/cache/.snapshots`; project snapshots under `/projectsX/.snapshots`.
